This would be my diary of discontent, a chronicle of all the injustices I suffered at the hands of my former employer.

**Seek out allies**

I'd reach out to my former colleagues, the ones who suffered alongside me, and ask them to join me in my quest for justice. Together, we'd form a coalition of the disgruntled, a group of whistleblowers who'd brave the storm and speak truth to power.

**Take it to the internet**

I'd create a blog, a Twitter account, a Facebook page... whatever it takes to get my message out there. I'd write scathing reviews, post scorching testimonials, and share my story with the world. I'd make sure that anyone who dares to Google my former employer's name would see my warnings, my rants, my righteous indignation.

**Contact the authorities**

If my former employer's wrongdoing was truly egregious, I'd take it to the authorities. I'd file a complaint with the labor department, the EEOC, the FTC... wherever I could find a sympathetic ear. I'd make sure that the powers that be know about the injustices that were perpetrated against me and my fellow workers.

**Sue them**

If all else fails, I'd take my former employer to court. I'd sue them for every penny they've got, for every moment of suffering they've caused me. I'd make them pay for their sins, and I'd make sure that the world knows about it.
